comments:
A null pointer exception can occur in CSSPage.java when no element has been selected in the DOM Inspector. To recreate the problem do the following steps

1. Open the Mozilla perspective.
2. Select the CSS view
3. Go to the project explorer in the Mozilla perspective
4. Run the Ajax application using "Run in Mozilla"
5. Hover over an element in the page opened in the Mozilla browser. 

A null pointer exception occurs because no element has been selected in the DOM Inspector. The exception occurs until an element is selected in the DOM Inspector. Below is the stack trace


Java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.mozilla.xpcom.internal.XPCOMJavaProxy.isXPCOMJavaProxy(XPCOMJavaProxy.java:190)
at org.mozilla.xpcom.internal.XPCOMJavaProxy.proxyEquals(XPCOMJavaProxy.java:174)
at org.mozilla.xpcom.internal.XPCOMJavaProxy.invoke(XPCOMJavaProxy.java:118)
at $Proxy14.equals(Unknown Source)
at org.eclipse.atf.mozilla.ide.ui.css.CSSPage.checkStyle(CSSPage.java:1152)
at org.eclipse.atf.mozilla.ide.ui.css.CSSPage.attributeModified(CSSPage.java:1164)
at org.eclipse.atf.mozilla.ide.ui.browser.MozBrowserEditor$36.run(MozBrowserEditor.java:1460)
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37)
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.run(Platform.java:843)
at org.eclipse.ui.internal.JFaceUtil$1.run(JFaceUtil.java:44)
checked in a fix to check for null on the current node.
